instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> loud fan not botting
threads.message:
Clean board, already tried reviving T2 it works and it looks like it finishes but machine never shows image or boots.

Fans turn to max after about 1 minute, trackpad clicks.

SSD voltages are present.
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH1</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH2</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_CPU_R</SIGNAL> present

<SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH2</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPVCC_CPU_PH3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_CPU_PH2</SIGNAL> missing

This one seems above my pay grade, any help is appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> loud fan not botting
threads.message:
My question first.
Do you really expect different readings on 3 coils tied together?
Don't waste time in the future, in such manner.

Board can't boot, if no VCORE present.
There could be CPU, or PCH problem.
Do you get voltage at L1701/02 and L8102?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> loud fan not botting
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> loud fan not botting
threads.message:
"There could be CPU, or PCH problem."
More probable bad CPU.
Test the board alone on the desk.

Any history available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> loud fan not botting
threads.message: No history, board alone on desk was also tested and no luck, CPU heats up but no activity.
